lines.text: In the interest of clarity and sanity, the rest of this movie will not be in Polish.
If it wasn't for Jews, fags, and gypsies, there would be no theater.
[Frederick, Andre, and Dobish are disguised as Hitler and two Nazi offiers]
Heil Hitler!
Heil Hitler!
Heil myself!
[of Bronski's performance]
What he did to Hamlet, we are now doing to Poland.
Mrs. Bronski, Mrs. Bronski, Mrs. Bronski.
We're all here.
Are you all right?
I'm fine.
Then why are you on the floor?
The Floor? I'm on the floor? I'm on the FLOOR. Well get me up.
He's world-famous in Poland!
All these flowers on a Lieutenant's pay, you shouldn't have.
That's OK. My father is a florist.
I loved that picture of you on the farm. You behind the plow. By the way, where was that?
In the "Chronicle".
No, I mean where's the farm?
Oh, the farm. The farm. Well, that's out of town somewhere... You know, that's where they keep them.
Oh, but that's enough talk about me. Let's talk about you. How'd you like me in the first act?
Enter, Andre Sobinski.
Exit, Sasha Kinski.

[to her pet dog]
Mootkie, we are living in a rat hole.
It's a, it's a, it's a RAT hole.
You are sitting in Col. Erhardt's chair.
Oh, how silly of me. Ten minutes ago it was my chair.

Vat do you mean you haven't got proof? Dat is no excuse! Arrezt zem! Vat? Vere? Vy? VEN? From now on, ven in doubt, arrezt zem! Arrezt zem! Arrezt zem! Arrezt zem! Zen shoot zem and interrogate zem! Oh, you are right, just shoot zem!
Ravitch, we're doing "Naughty Nazis", not "Naughty Marietta".
They say its going to be a really cold winter.
I don't know anyzing about zat!
Oh look, a piano! With KEYS! And it WORKS!

[as Hitler]
All I want is peace. Peace! Peace!
[singing]
A little piece of Poland, a little piece of France.

[disguised as Prof. Siletski]
Remember, Erhardt, I'm going to see the Fuhrer tonight. Who knows *what* we'll talk about!
[Anne has revealed another group of refugees to Frederick]
More! What are they, Jews or rabbits?

[as the Nazis are searching for Sasha]
First you invade Poland, then you invade Warsaw, then you invade my dressing room... you people are compulsive invaders!

[Anna has just turned down Erhardt's invitation for supper]
I never sup after I've dined.
[Sasha puts on his coat to go out]
What's that on your coat?
Oh, it's the newest fashion in occupied Warsaw. Jews wear yellow stars, homosexuals wear pink triangles.
Sasha! How awful for you!

[quietly]
I hate it.
Now listen, they're rounding up Jews. Are they rounding up...?
No, no, so far, so good. Now, don't wait up for me. I've got a hot date with another triangle.
[Frederick, disguised as Hitler, bursts in on Erhardt trying to assault Anna]

[weakly]
Heil Hit... Hit... Hit...
Hitler.
Hitler.
Heil.
I tried to tell him somebody big was coming.
Big! But...
Come schatze, ve're late.
[Anna exits, but Frederick turns back to Erhardt]
Vat's your name?
Colonel Er... Er... Er...
[sticking her head back in]
Erhardt.
Thank you.
Erhardt? Erhardt? Aren't you the one who makes that joke about my becoming... A PICKLE?
[He leaves, slamming the door. Erhardt moans]
[Frederick, disguised as Professor Siletski, has to go to Gestapo Headquarters]
Listen, sweetheart, if I don't come back, then I forgive you for anything that happened between you and Lt. Sobinski.
[He opens the door to leave, but turns back]
But if I do come back, you're in a lot of trouble!
[Frederick has to stall Prof. Siletski while the others rush back to his hotel room to search it]
Just don't keep me hanging much longer, I stink without a script!

[under his breath]
He stinks with a script.
I heard that!

[SPOILER]
Colonel, Professor Siletski's on the phone!
Professor Siletski? You didn't tell him he was dead?
Sondheim! Send in the clowns!

[Referring to Bronski in the next room]
Relax, Schultz! Zis iz ze intellectual approach...
And what if he's not an intellectual?

[referring to the two SS officers nearby]
Zen zey'll break every bone in his body!

[referring to Capt. Schultz]
I've always suspected zumzing wrong vit a man who does not drink or shmoke...
You mean like our FUHRER?
Yes... NO!
[Frederick returns home, having succesfully impersonated Siletski at Gestapo headquarters]
I did it! I did it! I gave the greatest performance of my life...
[sinks into a chair and peels off his fake beard]
And nobody saw it.

[Disguised as Siletski]
Remember, Earhardt, I'm going to see the Furher tonight - who knows *what* we'll talk about!
When this is allover, I'm gonna get you everything you need. You need a coat... you need a dress... you need shoes.
[Rubbing Andre's face, thinking he's Anna]
and you need a shave...
[he thinks]
... a shave?
Cigar? Cigarette? Chocolate-covered nugats?
Chocolate-covered what?
Nugats!
[Squishing one in his fingers]
No. Thank you.
If we don't make it through this, I forgive you for whatever happened between you and Lt. Sobinsky... but if we do, you're in a lot of trouble!
[Infuriated at Sobinski leaving the audience in the middle of his soliloquy, Frederick starts delivering the rest of his lines with uncharacteristic fire]

[watching from offstage]
What happened? He's good tonight.
